query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Io mi rivolsi a l’amoroso suono 8 del mio conforto; e qual io allor vidi 9 ne li occhi santi amor, qui l’abbandono:
10 non perch’ io pur del mio parlar diffidi, 11 ma per la mente che non può redire 12 sovra sé tanto, s’altri non la guidi.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I turned to the loving sound 8 of my comfort; and what I saw then 9 in those holy eyes of love, I leave here:
10 not because I doubt my own words, 11 but because the mind cannot return 12 to itself so far, unless another guides it.
**Cornish:**
7 Ythwravythwraghasowenaghkarantek 8 a'nghyfort; hagosywenaghwelow 9 y'nliholyowkarantek, yma y'mgallaf:
10 nagan rag ythwravythwraghasowenaghkarantek, 11 mes rag an meneth nag alla ythwraghas 12 warbarth, mar nag y'n aral aral y'n argyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Tanto poss’ io di quel punto ridire, 14 che, rimirando lei, lo mio affetto 15 libero fu da ogne altro disire,
16 fin che ’l piacere etterno, che diretto 17 raggiava in Bëatrice, dal bel viso 18 mi contentava col secondo aspetto.
query.result:
**English:**
13 So much can I say of that moment, 14 that, looking at her, my affection 15 was freed from every other desire,
16 until the eternal pleasure, which shone directly 17 in Beatrice, from her beautiful face 18 contented me with its secondary aspect.
**Cornish:**
13 Kemmys yth alla y'mgallaf a henna poynt, 14 henna, wosa'm welas hy, henna karantek 15 o ve dha'n ober agas karantek aral,
16 bys henna'n pleser travoes, henna a wragh 17 yn Bëatrice, a'y bennfager, 18 a wraghasowenaghkarantek gans an nessa aspet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Vincendo me col lume d’un sorriso, 20 ella mi disse: «Volgiti e ascolta; 21 ché non pur ne’ miei occhi è paradiso».
query.result:
**English:**
19 Conquering me with the light of a smile, 20 she said to me: “Turn and listen; 21 for paradise is not only in my eyes.”
**Cornish:**
19 Y'n gwaynya orth gans golow a'n selyow, 20 hi a leveris dhymm: “Tro ha klew; 21 rag nag yw yn unig y'n lygagh an baradys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Come si vede qui alcuna volta 23 l’affetto ne la vista, s’elli è tanto, 24 che da lui sia tutta l’anima tolta,
25 così nel fiammeggiar del folgór santo, 26 a ch’io mi volsi, conobbi la voglia 27 in lui di ragionarmi ancora alquanto.
query.result:
**English:**
22 As one can sometimes see here 23 affection in a glance, if it is so strong 24 that the whole soul is taken by it,
25 so in the flashing of the holy lightning, 26 to which I turned, I recognized the desire 27 in it to speak to me further.
**Cornish:**
22 Dell yw gweles ama yma nebes 23 an affectyon y'n an golwg, mar yw kemmys, 24 bys ma'th ev an eneval oll an eneval,
25 hemma yn flammedya an folgor sans, 26 dhe'th ythwraghas orth, yth eneval an voglia 27 ynno dhe ragea orth vy dhe vos nebes moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 El cominciò: «In questa quinta soglia 29 de l’albero che vive de la cima 30 e frutta sempre e mai non perde foglia,
31 spiriti son beati, che giù, prima 32 che venissero al ciel, fuor di gran voce, 33 sì ch’ogne musa ne sarebbe opima.
query.result:
**English:**
28 He began: “In this fifth circle 29 of the tree that lives from its top 30 and bears fruit always and never loses its leaves,
31 are blessed spirits, who down below, before 32 they came to heaven, were of great renown, 33 so that every muse would be enriched by them.
**Cornish:**
28 Ev a leveris: “Y'n an pympes soglia 29 a'n aval ma byw a'y benn 30 ha froeth byth ha nag coll goveth foel,
31 sperysi yw bennak, anedha, kyns 32 dos o dhe'n nef, o lagas bras, 33 byttegys pub musa a via gwell.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Però mira ne’ corni de la croce: 35 quello ch’io nomerò, lì farà l’atto 36 che fa in nube il suo foco veloce».
query.result:
**English:**
34 Therefore look at the horns of the cross: 35 the one I shall name will perform there the act 36 that his swift fire performs in a cloud.
**Cornish:**
34 Rag hemma, sel orth y'n kornow an groes: 35 henna vyth y'm gorra, ena a wra an gwreans 36 henna a wra y'n golow y'n niben an tan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Io vidi per la croce un lume tratto 38 dal nomar Iosuè, com’ el si feo; 39 né mi fu noto il dir prima che ’l fatto.
query.result:
**English:**
37 I saw a light drawn along the cross 38 by the naming of Joshua, as he did it; 39 and I did not know what he meant to say before he did it.
**Cornish:**
37 Yth gweles orth an groes golow a-dhall 38 gans an hanow Iosuè, dell wrug ev; 39 ha nag esa gwythys dhymm kyns an gwrians.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 E al nome de l’alto Macabeo 41 vidi moversi un altro roteando, 42 e letizia era ferza del paleo.
query.result:
**English:**
40 And at the name of the noble Maccabee 41 I saw another move, circling, 42 and joy was the whip of his top.
**Cornish:**
40 Ha dhe'n hanow an Macabeo uhel 41 yth gweles aral a-drohe, 42 ha lowenaeth o lagas y'n golow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Così per Carlo Magno e per Orlando 44 due ne seguì lo mio attento sguardo, 45 com’ occhio segue suo falcon volando.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Thus for Charlemagne and for Roland 44 my attentive gaze followed two, 45 as an eye follows its falcon in flight.
**Cornish:**
43 Dell hemma rag Carlo Magno ha rag Orlando 44 dew a-wrug vyth y'm golwg a-dhista, 45 dell y'n lagha a-wrug y'n falcon a-hedhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Poscia trasse Guiglielmo e Rinoardo 47 e ’l duca Gottifredi la mia vista 48 per quella croce, e Ruberto Guiscardo.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Afterwards my sight drew William and Rainoard 47 and Duke Godfrey across that cross, 48 and Robert Guiscard.
**Cornish:**
46 Wosa hemma a-dhall Guiglielmo ha Rinoardo 47 ha'n dug Gottifredi y'm golwg 48 orth an groes henna, ha Ruberto Guiscardo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Indi, tra l’altre luci mota e mista, 50 mostrommi l’alma che m’avea parlato 51 qual era tra i cantor del cielo artista.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Then, among the other lights moving and mingled, 50 the soul that had spoken to me showed me 51 who among the singers of heaven was an artist.
**Cornish:**
49 Wosa, ynter an erel golow ha kesmyskys, 50 an eneval a wra vedhes omma kov, 51 pyw o onan a'n kanerion a'n nef o artyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 E come, per sentir più dilettanza 59 bene operando, l’uom di giorno in giorno 60 s’accorge che la sua virtute avanza,
61 sì m’accors’ io che ’l mio girare intorno 62 col cielo insieme avea cresciuto l’arco, 63 veggendo quel miracol più addorno.
query.result:
**English:**
58 And as, in order to feel more delight 59 in doing good, a man from day to day 60 notices that his virtue advances,
61 so I realized that my circling around 62 with the heavens had increased the arc, 63 seeing that miracle more adorned.
**Cornish:**
58 Ha dell yw, rag mos moy pleser, 59 ow ober da, den dhe den 60 den a wra weles y vos kres.
61 Dell yw, y'm weles ow trohe war dro, 62 gans an nef, a wra kres an bogalen, 63 ow tos an myraklen moy lowenek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 E qual è ’l trasmutare in picciol varco 65 di tempo in bianca donna, quando ’l volto 66 suo si discarchi di vergogna il carco,
67 tal fu ne li occhi miei, quando fui vòlto, 68 per lo candor de la temprata stella 69 sesta, che dentro a sé m’avea ricolto.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And as is the transformation in a short space 65 of time into a fair lady, when her face 66 unburdens itself of the burden of shame,
67 such was it in my eyes, when I turned, 68 because of the whiteness of the temperate star 69 of the sixth hour, which had received me within itself.
**Cornish:**
64 Ha dell yw, kepar an chanjya yn skon termyn, 65 dhe wrek yn benen wynn, pan vo y golwg 66 a skwych an bewnans a'y gonis.
67 Dell yw o yn y'n golwg, pan droes y'm, 68 rag gwynnder an steren temperys 69 a'n nessa our, a wra'm resevyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Io vidi in quella giovïal facella 71 lo sfavillar de l’amor che lì era 72 segnare a li occhi miei nostra favella.
query.result:
**English:**
70 I saw in that joyful torch 71 the sparkling of the love that was there 72 signifying to my eyes our speech.
**Cornish:**
70 Y'm gweles yn an flamm joyful hyn 71 an splann a'n karanteth o o, 72 ow merkya dhe'm golwg an lavarow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 E come augelli surti di rivera, 74 quasi congratulando a lor pasture, 75 fanno di sé or tonda or altra schiera,
76 sì dentro ai lumi sante creature 77 volitando cantavano, e faciensi 78 or D, or I, or L in sue figure.
query.result:
**English:**
73 And like birds come forth from a riverbank, 74 as if congratulating each other on their feeding, 75 make of themselves now a round or other formation,
76 so within the lights the holy creatures 77 flew about singing, and formed 78 now D, now I, now L with their figures.
**Cornish:**
73 Ha dell yw, kepar edhennow a-dhyworth avon, 74 kepar ow lowen an eyl orth, 75 ow kul dro dhe'n golwg po skon furv.
76 Dell yw, bys yn an golow, an kreatyow sans, 77 ow hedhi ha kanas, ha ow furvya 78 po D, po I, po L yn aga furvow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Prima, cantando, a sua nota moviensi; 80 poi, diventando l’un di questi segni, 81 un poco s’arrestavano e taciensi.
query.result:
**English:**
79 First, singing, they moved to their own tune; 80 then, becoming one of these signs, 81 they would pause for a while and be silent.
**Cornish:**
79 Kyns, ow kanas, dhe aga nota ow movyas; 80 wosa, ow tos onan a'n merkysow ma, 81 ow pausa rag skon termyn ha tavas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 O diva Pegasëa che li ’ngegni 83 fai glorïosi e rendili longevi, 84 ed essi teco le cittadi e ’ regni,
85 illustrami di te, sì ch’io rilevi 86 le lor figure com’ io l’ho concette: 87 paia tua possa in questi versi brevi!
88 Mostrarsi dunque in cinque volte sette 89 vocali e consonanti; e io notai 90 le parti sì, come mi parver dette.
query.result:
**English:**
82 O divine Pegasus, who makes 83 intellects glorious and grants them long life, 84 and through them cities and kingdoms,
85 enlighten me with yourself, so that I may recount 86 their figures as I have conceived them: 87 let your power shine in these brief verses!
88 They showed themselves then in five times seven 89 vowels and consonants; and I noted 90 the parts just as they seemed to me to be spoken.
**Cornish:**
82 O dheves Pegasëa, pyw an intellektys 83 ow kul glorius ha ow kul hir, 84 ha dretha an cita ha'n gwlaskorow,
85 lowen dhyworth dhe'm, rag y'm gallos diskwedhes 86 aga furvow kepar ha'm kevysys: 87 diskwedh dhe bos yn an versys skon ma!
88 Ytho ow tos yn pymp termyn seth 89 bogalen ha konsonans; ha'm merkys 90 an rann ma kepar ha'n kov dheth leverys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 ‘DILIGITE IUSTITIAM’, primai 92 fur verbo e nome di tutto ’l dipinto; 93 ‘QUI IUDICATIS TERRAM’, fur sezzai.
query.result:
**English:**
91 “LOVE JUSTICE,” they said first, 92 as a verb and noun of all the painting; 93 “YOU WHO JUDGE THE EARTH,” they said below.
**Cornish:**
91 “KAROW AN GYVRYS”, kov an kynsa, 92 o verbo ha hanow a'n oll an peyntiys; 93 “WHY A VREYL AN NOR”, kov an nessa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Poscia ne l’emme del vocabol quinto 95 rimasero ordinate; sì che Giove 96 pareva argento lì d’oro distinto.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Then in the middle of the fifth word 95 they remained arranged; so that Jove 96 seemed there of silver distinct from gold.
**Cornish:**
94 Wosa, yn kres an pympes hanow, 95 ow tos ordenys; kepar ha'n Jehov, 96 o arghans ow tos gwelys, ow tos areth a'n our.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E vidi scendere altre luci dove 98 era il colmo de l’emme, e lì quetarsi 99 cantando, credo, il ben ch’a sé le move.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And I saw other lights descend where 98 was the summit of the M, and there they paused, 99 singing, I believe, the good that moves them towards it.
**Cornish:**
97 Ha'm gweles golow orth dallethow le mayth 98 o'n top a'n M, ha'gas onan eth sevel, 99 ow kanna, yth wra, an da a wra ow movya orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Poi, come nel percuoter d’i ciocchi arsi 101 surgono innumerabili faville, 102 onde li stolti sogliono agurarsi,
103 resurger parver quindi più di mille 104 luci e salir, qual assai e qual poco, 105 sì come ’l sol che l’accende sortille;
106 e quïetata ciascuna in suo loco, 107 la testa e ’l collo d’un’aguglia vidi 108 rappresentare a quel distinto foco.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then, as from the striking of burning logs 101 innumerable sparks arise, 102 from which the foolish are wont to draw omens,
103 more than a thousand lights seemed to rise up from there 104 and ascend, some more, some less, 105 just as the sun that kindles them determines;
106 and when each one had settled in its place, 107 I saw the head and neck of an eagle 108 represented by that distinct fire.
**Cornish:**
100 Wosa, kepar an darow bys y'n keun keskis, 101 y feu efan dhe lies, 102 owth uskis an folis ow kul owth aresi,
103 moy a vil tir mil a'n goleudhow, 104 ow sevel, nebes moy ha neb es, 105 kepar hag an howl ow'th enkynna.
106 Ha pan o esedh pubonan yn y le, 107 y ben ha'n kodha er en erel 108 owth omdhiskwedhes gans an tan owth enkynna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Quei che dipinge lì, non ha chi ’l guidi; 110 ma esso guida, e da lui si rammenta 111 quella virtù ch’è forma per li nidi.
query.result:
**English:**
109 He who paints there has no one to guide him; 110 but he guides himself, and from him is remembered 111 that virtue which is the form for the nests.
**Cornish:**
109 An hini a dhev lyn, nyns eus neb ow'th omladha; 110 mes ev a omladh, ha dhodho gensi 111 an nerth honan furv dhe'n neythow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 L’altra bëatitudo, che contenta 113 pareva prima d’ingigliarsi a l’emme, 114 con poco moto seguitò la ’mprenta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 The other blessedness, which seemed content 113 to adorn itself with lilies before the M, 114 with a gentle motion followed the imprint.
**Cornish:**
112 An erel bewnans, ow sevel kontent 113 dhe omdhiskwedhes kyns an M gans lilis, 114 gans movyans melyon eth omsewa an pren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 O dolce stella, quali e quante gemme 116 mi dimostraro che nostra giustizia 117 effetto sia del ciel che tu ingemme!
118 Per ch’io prego la mente in che s’inizia 119 tuo moto e tua virtute, che rimiri 120 ond’ esce il fummo che ’l tuo raggio vizia;
121 sì ch’un’altra fïata omai s’adiri 122 del comperare e vender dentro al templo 123 che si murò di segni e di martìri.
query.result:
**English:**
115 O sweet star, what and how many gems 116 you showed me, that our justice 117 is the effect of the heaven that you adorn with jewels!
118 Therefore I pray to the mind in which begins 119 your motion and your virtue, that you look down 120 from where the smoke comes that tarnishes your rays;
121 so that once again you may be angered 122 by the buying and selling within the temple 123 that was built with signs and martyrdoms.
**Cornish:**
115 O steren dowr, pyth ha py le a gemmow 116 a omdhiskwedhes dhym, an gonan gonan justice 117 yw effeyth a'n nef owth enjymma!
118 Rag henna yth pyth an menow y'n kever 119 dha wovernans ha dha nerth, owth omwel 120 owth le mayth an fumm owth omdhrehevel dha skynnans;
121 kepar pub termyn arall bythkweth owth gorra 122 orth an prena ha'n gwertha y'n-mes an tempel 123 owth omfurvya gans merkys ha martriow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 O milizia del ciel cu’ io contemplo, 125 adora per color che sono in terra 126 tutti svïati dietro al malo essemplo!
127 Già si solea con le spade far guerra; 128 ma or si fa togliendo or qui or quivi 129 lo pan che ’l pïo Padre a nessun serra.
query.result:
**English:**
124 O heavenly host that I behold, 125 pray for those who are on earth, 126 all the saints who follow the evil example!
127 Once war was waged with swords; 128 but now it is waged by taking here and there 129 the bread that the most pious Father denies to no one.
**Cornish:**
124 O lu dhe'n nef, pyth y'm gwelas, 125 pyth adhori orth an re beus y'n-bys 126 pub an sansow eth omsewa an drok ensampel!
127 Kyns o esedh gans kleworyow o wrug gweres; 128 mes lemmyn yth wrug gans omkemeres yma ha'gas 129 an bara owth omdhrehevel an Tas Piusa dhe bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Ma tu che sol per cancellare scrivi, 131 pensa che Pietro e Paulo, che moriro 132 per la vigna che guasti, ancor son vivi.
query.result:
**English:**
130 But you who write only to erase, 131 think that Peter and Paul, who died 132 for the vineyard that you are destroying, are still alive.
**Cornish:**
130 Mes taves, owth skrif orth omdhrehevel hepken, 131 meurysi ow Peder ha Pol, ow mernis 132 rag an winyard owth omdhrehevel, yw bewnans byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Ben puoi tu dire: «I’ ho fermo ’l disiro 134 sì a colui che volle viver solo 135 e che per salti fu tratto al martiro,
136 ch’io non conosco il pescator né Polo».
query.result:
**English:**
133 You can well say: "I have set my desire 134 so on him who chose to live alone 135 and who was dragged to martyrdom by leaps and bounds,
136 that I do not know the fisherman or Paul."
**Cornish:**
133 Yth gallos taves leverel: "Y'm eus gorra'n dysyr 134 kepar dhe'n hini a vynnas bewnans hepken 135 ha owth omdhrehevel dhe omladha dhe'n mersiroths,
136 owth nyns eus gorra'n pyscador po Pol."
